intro: Erigeron mendocinus, commonly known as the Mendocino fleabane, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations.
